basics.name: Giulia Martinelli
basics.label: Post-Doc Researcher in Computer Vision & Graphics
basics.summary: Post-Doc researcher working at the intersection of Computer Vision and Computer Graphics, with a focus on realistic Digital Humans and the full pipeline from 3D reconstruction to motion capture, retargeting, and real-time animation.

work.name: University of Trento - Department of Information Engineering and Computer Science
work.summary: Research on realistic Digital Humans, from high-fidelity appearance reconstruction to motion capture, motion retargeting and real-time animation in interactive environments.
highlights: Parametric human models (SMPL, SMPL-X) for body, face and hands
Markerless and marker-based motion capture (e.g., OptiTrack)
Motion retargeting and animation control for real-time applications
Applications in VR/AR and sports analytics

work.name: University of Trento
work.summary: Teaching assistant and tutor for courses and projects in Computer Vision, Sport Technology and related topics.
highlights: Teaching Assistant for Computer Vision Course (A.A. 2021/2022, 2022/2023, 2023/2024)
Laboratory Tutor for Sport Tech Course (A.A. 2024/2025)
Supervision of Motion Capture, Computer Vision and Sport Tech projects

work.name: Tampere University - ESA Rahtu Group
work.summary: PhD period abroad working with a Volumetric Capture system for creating a synthetic dataset of human characters.
highlights: Automatic rigging and skinning of captured characters
Cloth animation and conversion of scans into virtual characters for virtual environments

work.name: University of Trento
work.summary: Research at the intersection of human pose estimation and gender recognition.
highlights: Development of a gender recognition algorithm based on pose detection and motion analysis
Human pose estimation from top-view RGB images
